review: A few bumps in the road.  In the packaging, it appeared to be brand new.  So far it works as described if plugged directly into my TV's HDMI slot.  Set up was easy.  It experiences very frequent lapses in the signal, however, when plugged into an HDMI signal splitter.  This makes it far less convenient to use than I had imagined, as I also use my laptop as a tuner and cast that signal wirelessly through an HP Wireless TV Connect, so need HDMI expansion.If you have a TV with multiple HDMI connections, I think you will be very satisfied with the Roku stick.  Set up and response is quick, interface is pretty simple.  Menus are geared to Amazon and MGO content, but there is a dedicated Netflix button. I don't have experience with other Roku systems for comparison, but there are a couple of very comprehensive reviews on site which explain the advantages/disadvantages of each.
